info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 06 at 8:43PM EDT until July 06 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM EDT FOR EASTERN PERSON...NORTHERN VANCE...NORTHWESTERN WARREN AND NORTHERN GRANVILLE COUNTIES... At 843 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 9 miles northeast of Oxford to 7 miles south of Virgilina, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Henderson, Oxford, Roxboro, Warrenton, Norlina, Stovall, Middleburg, Mayo Reservoir, and Kerr Lake. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Straight line winds can blow down trees, power lines, and damage mobile homes and other buildings. Seek shelter in a sturdy structure until the storm has passed. Stay away from windows. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
